intro: Quassia cedron, commonly known as the bitterwood tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Simaroubaceae family and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The tree produces yellowish-green flowers and small, woody fruits containing seeds. Its most notable feature is the bitter taste of its wood and roots, which contain quassinoids—compounds with medicinal properties. Quassia cedron is often used in traditional medicine for its antimicrobial and antiparasitic effects.
